Package com.example.user.schachapp.chessLogic

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    RuleProvider
    A interface which determines what methods a ruleProvider should implement
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Bishop
    a bishop
    BoardState
    Represents a chessboard with all necessary information to recreate a chessgame at a certain point.
    Castling
    A castling which extends move and consists of start, goal, and a additional rook move
    ChessRuleProvider
    Implements all chess rules, using several methods.
    EnPassant
    EnPassant, extends move and consists of start, goal and a position where a pawn has to be removed
    King
    a king
    Knight
    a knight
    Move
    A move, consisting of a start and a goal position.
    MoveFactory
    A factory that can create a certain type of move from a given string
    Pawn
    a pawn
    Piece
    the abstract concept of a chesspiece
    PieceFactory
    A factory that can create a certain type of piece from a given string
    Position
    Represents a position on a chessboard, meaning both coordinates should be between 0-7
    Promotion
    A promotion which extends move and consists of start, goal and the piece to be promoted to
    Queen
    a queen
    Result
    A result, consisting of two seperate strings.
    Rook
    a rook
    Tile
    Represents a square on a chessboard, which can contain a piece.
